properties.Reported_Impact: Israel launched a large-scale air campaign. Strikes hit Natanz nuclear enrichment facility, destroying above-ground sections. Significant damage to air defenses and missile sites reported.
As part of a large-scale air campaign, military and infrastructure targets were hit. Senior nuclear scientists and IRGC commanders were targeted.
Israel attacked the IRGC's largest missile site in Khorramabad, targeting ballistic missile capabilities.
Explosions heard across Tehran, with air defense systems activated to intercept Israeli strikes. 78 people killed, over 320 wounded, mostly civilians, according to Iran's UN ambassador.
Explosions reported in Qom. Part of wider strikes where 78 people were killed and over 320 wounded.
A radar site near Tabriz was targeted. Part of wider strikes where 78 people were killed and over 320 wounded.
Iran launched over 100 missiles and drones. Most were intercepted, but some caused critical injuries (two people), moderate injuries (eight), and slight injuries (34) from shrapnel.
Iran launched over 100 missiles and drones. Most were intercepted, but some caused critical injuries and shrapnel wounds.

properties.City/Region: South Pars Gas Field, Bushehr Province
properties.Reported_Impact: Israeli drones struck the South Pars Gas Field, causing a blaze that was later extinguished. The scale of disruption remains unclear.

properties.City/Region: Shahran oil depot, northwest of Tehran
properties.Reported_Impact: Israeli strike caused a fire at the Shahran oil depot. The depot holds about 8 million liters of gasoline daily, threatening significant damage to nearby residential areas.
Four people, including women and children, were killed in Bat Yam, south of Tel Aviv, with scores more wounded due to a blast damaging a multistory building.
Iranian missiles struck northern Israel, killing three people and wounding 13.
Iran launched a new wave of drone and missile attacks targeting Haifa and Tel Aviv. No specific casualty or damage details reported.
Israeli strikes hit an oil refinery in southern Tehran, causing heavy smoke and fire.
Iranian missile strike hit the Bazan oil refinery in Haifa, killing three people.

Iranian missile barrage caused significant casualties in Rehovot, with debris, bloodstained bandages, and shattered glass reported. At least 24 people killed, 380 wounded in wider attacks across Israel on this day.
Israeli air force conducted strikes on storage and missile launch infrastructure sites in western Iran. At least 224 people killed, 1,481 wounded in wider attacks across Iran on this day.
Iran launched missiles targeting Tel Aviv. Three people killed, over 70 injured (one in serious condition, five in moderate condition). Damage reported to two buildings in Tel Aviv.
Israeli strike hit Iranian state TV headquarters, causing black smoke to billow.
Iranian missile struck a residential building, killing three people and causing property damage.
Two Iranian drones intercepted over the Golan Heights, heading from southern Syria. No casualties or damage reported.
Israeli strikes hit underground infrastructure at Natanz, likely damaging or destroying thousands of centrifuges. No radiation increase reported.
Iranian missile barrage hit the Weizmann Institute, causing unprecedented casualties and massive destruction.
Hit centrifuge manufacturing workshop, no casualties reported.
Targeted military installation, no details on impacts.
Saeed Izadi killed.
Israeli drone strike killed three civilians near Montazeri hospital.
Israeli airstrike killed seven IRGC members and two conscripts.
U.S. airstrikes with bunker-busting bombs targeted the underground nuclear enrichment site. Facilities 'obliterated'.

properties.City/Region: Fordow Fuel Enrichment Facility, near Qom

On 20 June 2025, at least one of the ballistic missiles in a barrage that Iran fired at Israel achieved a direct hit in Haifa, injuring dozens of civilians and causing extensive property damage. Two mosques were among the buildings damaged due to the direct impact. About 25 missiles were fired in the barrage.

On 20 June 2025, at least two of the ballistic missiles that Iran fired at Israel throughout the day achieved direct hits in Beersheba (Beer Sheva, HaDarom), injuring several civilians, causing extensive property damage, and setting several cars on fire. According to the IDF, one of the missiles that impacted Beersheba was a missile carrying a cluster bomb warhead, leading to several impacts in the city. A daycare and two homes were among the properties damaged in the attacks.

On 20 June 2025, shrapnel from Iranian ballistic missile interceptions and other 'impact sites' were reported in central Israel, causing property damage, including to a school. No casualties reported. The falling shrapnel and impact sites came during the barrage of about 25 missiles. No locations specified. Coded to Tel Aviv.

Interception: On 13 June 2025, Israeli military forces intercepted ballistic missiles fired by Iran at Israel over the area of Rosh Haayin (Petah Tiqwa, HaMerkaz). Israeli military forces estimated that Iran launched fewer than 100 ballistic missiles on Friday, while Iran claimed to fire hundreds. Iran launched the ballistic missiles and over 100 drones at Israel as part of their retaliatory response to Israeli attacks on nuclear sites and Iranian officials. Most of the missiles were intercepted or fell short prior to reaching Israeli territory. All of the drones were shot down by Israeli forces and other air defenses in the region, with very few reaching Israeli territory.
